intro: Baryosma tongo, commonly known as the African nettle, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Urticaceae, which includes many stinging plants. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in clusters. Baryosma tongo is typically found in moist, shaded areas such as forests and along riverbanks.
